page.title: 02Health Care in Kelso
page.content: Kelso has two hospitals-the{Cottage {Hospital}and{The Inch}- one{Health {Centre}on{Inch Road}and four separate {dental practices,}two of which are in the Health Centre. The Inch is a {geriatric hospital}with two wards containing 45 beds. It is visited by three doctors and altogether 50 staff work there. The Cottage Hospital is for{general medical care}(including {maternity),}but serious cases go to Peel Hospital near Galashiels, or Edinburgh. The{uniquely-designed {Health Centre}was opened in{1967}and its 7 doctors have responsibility for {10000}patients. Each doctor has {1700 and roughly{200}people use the Centre each day. The town's dentists treat {7000}people usually at 6 monthly intervals. 4 are visiting dentists to the Health Centre, the other 3 work in 2 permanant practices in the town.
